documents.title: black friday ends in london blackout
text: central london has been plunged into complete darkness as a lights went out on lower regents street and throughout soho .
traffic lights stopped working and shops have begun emptying of customers .
as yet it is unclear what caused the lights to go out .
all of the traffic lights have gone off too , so it 's a bit of a free for all .
# powercut # blackfriday

go ahead

thanks
sure , no problem

documents.title: two more arrested over bow policeman stabbing
text: police investigating the stabbing of a plain clothes police officer while on duty in east london have arrested two more people .
a 20-year-old man and a 34-year-old woman were both arrested at an address in bow on friday on sus of attempted murder .
a 17-year-old man was arrested on tuesday night following the attack on sus of attempted murder .
he was released on bail until late january 2017 .

documents.title: murder probe after boy dies following park 'incident
text: police have started a murder investigation after a five-year-old boy suffered critical injuries in a south-east london park .
scotland yard said the boy was taken to hospital with head injuries following an `` incident involving a man '' in mountsfield park , catford , on sunday .
the child died on tuesday .
post-mortem tests took place on thursday .
a 38-year-old man was arrested on monday and subsequently charged with grievous bodily harm with intent .

documents.title: a21 reopening delayed by six months
text: a21 reopening delayed by six months

documents.title: southern rail service hits national punctuality figures
text: endless problems on trains services at southern are dragging down national punctuality levels , according to the rail regulator .
a report by the office of rail and road ( orr ) describes overall punctuality and reliability across britain as `` mixed '' , but generally `` poor '' .
the report covers the period from the start of april until mid-october .
it says the biggest drag on performance is govia thameslink rail ( gtr ) , which operates southern trains .

documents.title: serial killer port given whole life term
text: serial killer port given whole life term

text: mobility scooter crash peer dead

text: mikel hints at chelsea january exit

documents.title: 17 officers investigated over stephen port case
text: following port 's conviction on wednesday , commander stuart cundy said he had written a letter of condolence to the loved ones of the young men and apologised for `` missed opportunities '' .
a total of 17 officers are being investigated over their handling of the case , seven of whom could face the sack if found to be guilty of gross misconduct .
the force is now re-examining 58 unexplained deaths involving the drug ghb from a four-year period across london to make sure that foul play has not been missed in any other cases .
following the verdicts , mr taylor 's family , who are planning to sue , said : `` we do believe jack would still be here if they had done their job .
the police should be held accountable for jack 's death . ''

documents.title: breakingpeer dies after being knocked off his mobility scooter
text: labour peer lord taylor of blackburn has died after he was knocked off his mobility scooter outside parliament last week , a party spokesman said .

documents.title: stephen port `` descended into a vortex ''
text: in mitigation , david etheridge qc , said that on the jury verdicts , in this period of his life , stephen port `` descended into a vortex '' in which drug taking fuelled his private life with satisfaction of his sexual desire .
`` he graduated from a fetish to a fixation from a fixation to a compulsion , '' he said .

documents.title: 'there is no pain greater than losing a child '
text: earlier , statements from the loved ones of the four murder victims and one of port 's sex assault victims were summarised by prosecutor jonathan rees qc .
the mother of mr walgate said the death of her son had `` devastated and broken the family '' .
adam , only brother of mr kovari spoke of the difficulty in telling their mother of his death , saying `` there is no pain greater than losing a child '' .
daniel whitworth 's father adam said he had been given `` a life sentence of grief '' .
the family of jack taylor told how his murder had turned their lives `` upside down '' .

documents.title: police urged to connect murders after family pressure
text: the deaths of jack taylor , anthony walgate , gabriel kovari and daniel whitworth over 15 months bore striking similarities but police failed to make the link until relatives of his final victim demanded answers .
following a trial , port was found guilty of the murders after a jury deliberated for 28 hours and 27 minutes .
he was also convicted of a string of sex offences against seven other men who came forward following his arrest .

documents.title: serial killer dumped bodies in graveyard
text: relatives of the victims cheered and clapped as mr justice openshaw told port he would never be released .
one woman in the public gallery of the old bailey courtroom called the impassive port a `` scumbag '' .
the 41-year-old chef stalked his victims on dating websites and plied them with drinks spiked with fatal amounts of the drug ghb to rape them while they were unconscious .
he dumped their bodies in or near a graveyard within 500 metres of his flat in barking , east london , and embarked on an elaborate cover-up .

documents.title: port 's murders were `` wicked and monstrous ''
text: the judge told port that he had carried out the murders to `` satisfy his lust '' for sex with young men who were rendered unconscious .
he highlighted port 's attempt to cover up two of his murders with a fake suicide notes as `` wicked and monstrous '' .

documents.title: breakingserial killer stephen port given whole life term sentence
text: serial killer stephen port , 41 , has been sentenced at the old bailey to a whole life term for the murder of four young gay men .

documents.title: heathrow third runway 'to breach climate change laws '
text: plans to expand heathrow airport are set to breach the government 's climate change laws , advisers have warned .
the committee on climate change says the business plan for heathrow projects a 15 % increase in aviation emissions by 2050 .
if that increase is allowed , members say , ministers will have to squeeze even deeper emissions cuts from other sectors of the economy .
the government said it was determined to keep to its climate change targets .

text: the partner of a gravesend man murdered by serial killer stephen port , believes lives could have been saved by a more thorough police investigation .

Reporter, BBC South East Today

documents.title: metropolitan police sex abuse case 'failings put children at risk '
text: children in london are being put at risk because of `` serious failings '' in the way the met police deals with child sexual abuse , inspectors have found .
hm inspectorate of constabulary ( hmic ) found 75 % of cases investigated by the force were dealt with `` inadequately '' or `` required improvement '' .
it said there was an `` indefensible '' lack of leadership in child protection , with no single officer in charge .
the met said children were a priority and it was sorry for any failures .

there will be brisk north-easterly winds though , which will be strong at times over high ground .
maximum temperature : 11c ( 52f )

documents.title: travel update : piccadilly line problems
text: on the piccadilly line there is no service between acton town and uxbridge due to shortage of trains and there are severe delays on rest of line .
on london midland there are delays of up to 40 minutes between watford junction and st albans abbey due to slippery rails .
and on thameslink there are delays of up to 15 mins between sevenoaks and luton due to poor rail conditions .
for the latest information go to our travel page or follow us on twitter @ twitterid
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: watch : officer speaks after moped gang jailed
text: four members of an armed moped gang who were intercepted as they were going to rob a watch shop have been jailed .
the met police say they are dealing with organised crime .

documents.title: kings of leon to headline hyde park festival
text: american rockers kings of leon will headline next summer 's british summer time festival in london .
the band will play in hyde park on thursday 6 july alongside us rock stalwarts pixies .
kings of leon drummer nathan followill said : `` it 's always a pleasure to party with our amazing fans at hyde park . ''
also appearing at british summer time across june and july are green day and phil collins whose appearance will be his biggest solo show to date .
kings of leon , who released latest album walls earlier this year , and pixies will be joined by us singer-songwriter nathaniel rateliff & the night sweats .

documents.title: fundraising launched to help west end child actress with life-changing op
text: the family of a child actress from london is hoping to raise £ 175,000 for a life changing operation in america .
lucy-mae , 14 , has scoliosis - a curvature in her spine - and without an operation , which her family say is not available on the nhs , the condition is likely to get worse .
lucy-mae made her west end debut in the hit musical matilda when she was 10..
so far almost £ 40,000 has been raised .

documents.title: mother of murdered ellie butler to challenge her perverting the course of justice conviction
text: the mother of ellie butler - the six-year-old murdered by her father - has launched a bid to challenge her conviction .
ben butler was convicted of murder in june following a trial at the old baileyand jailed for life with a minimum term of 23 years .
ellie 's mother , jennie gray , 36 , was given a 42-month term after being found guilty of child cruelty .
she had admitted perverting the course of justice .
a spokesman for the court of appeal confirmed today that she has made a `` late application '' for permission to appeal in relation to both child cruelty and perverting the course of justice .
the normal time limit to lodge an appeal is 28 days after conviction .
anyone lodging after that deadline has to make representations as to why their application should be accepted `` out of time '' by the court .

the old bailey trial heard that butler battered his daughter to death at the family home in sutton , south london , in a momentary but volcanic loss of temper after months of subjecting his partner and daughter to abuse .

documents.title: watch : singer returns to 'war ballroom ' for birthday milestone
text: singer helen clare returns to a `` war ballroom '' to celebrate 100th birthday .

text: watch : peter tatchell on the met police response to the stephen port murders

documents.title: commission finds sutton elderly charity failed to report thefts
text: an investigation by the charity commission has found that sutton liberal democrats may have been involved in preventing a prompt report to the police of serious concerns about the financial affairs of a local charity for the elderly..
the commission 's findings have led to calls for ruth dombey , the libdem leader of sutton council , to resign immediately .
author: Inside Croydon

documents.title: tube drivers to go on strike in december
text: tube drivers to go on strike in december

documents.title: night tsar amy lame apologises over `` offensive '' tory tweets
text: newly-appointed night tsar amy lame has written to six conservative borough council leaders to personally apologise for offensive tweets she has made in the past about the party and its politicians .
earlier this month sadiq khan has to defend appointing ms lame following claims she has a `` gratuitously offensive '' online presence .
the mayor was asked whether he found tweets which appeared to bemoan the queen 's long life and referred to `` tory scum '' as `` funny '' at mayor 's questions .
mr khan replied that he did not `` agree with or condone '' the tweets but thought she was `` the best person for the job '' .

documents.title: lu accuses rmt of being `` premature '' over tube strike call
text: london underground has revealed how many rmt members voted for strikes action next month .
in the ballot for the hammersmith & city line dispute 43 drivers our of 265 voted for strike action and 168 drivers on the piccadilly line out of 408 polled opted for action .

steve griffiths , london underground 's chief operating officer , said : we urge the rmt leadership to work with us constructively on the issues it has raised rather than disrupt our customers with strikes .

`` the announcement of strike dates is premature given that we have pre-arranged talks planned at acas tomorrow to discuss the rmt 's concerns on the piccadilly line , and on the hammersmith & city line we are waiting for the rmt 's response to our proposals to end that dispute . ''

documents.title: conservatives accuse mayor of 'failure ' over planned tube strikes
text: conservatives on london assembly have criticised sadiq khan for failing to bring an end to public transport strikes following the announcement that tube drivers on the piccadilly and hammersmith & city lines will strike in december .
transport spokesman keith prince said : once again a breakdown in industrial relations is to blame .
where is the mayor of london who promised he 'd 'talk to everyone who runs public transport to make sure there are zero days of strikes ' ?
sadiq khan has told us that 'strikes are ultimately a sign of failure ' .
i agree that he has failed but , whilst london is once again held to ransom by his union friends , he has opposed plans to crack down on strike action .

londoners will rightly be asking how many more strikes we must endure before the mayor recognises his mistakes and does everything possible to stop londoners being used as pawns in these petty disputes . ''

documents.title: serial killer 's 'drug dealer ' in court
text: serial killer 's 'drug dealer ' in court

documents.title: woman , 41 , found stabbed to death in north-east london
text: a woman has been found stabbed to death in north-east london .
a murder investigation has begun after the 41-year-old died at an address in bramble close , tottenham , on wednesday evening .
police had been called to the address following reports of an assault .
the victim was pronounced dead at the scene .
a 38-year-old man has been arrested on sus of murder and remains in custody .

documents.title: watch : murder victim 's family say future is 'heartbreaking '
text: stephen port was found guilty of murdering four young men .
one of his victims was jack taylor - his family spoke to dan clark-neal , a former metropolitan police detective .
see more on victoria derbyshire .

documents.title: police face abuse inquiry complaints
text: police face abuse inquiry complaints
author: Tom Symonds
Home Affairs correspondent

documents.title: four jailed over foiled armed robbery in piccadilly
text: four members of a moped gang who armed themselves with knives and an axe as they attempted to rob a luxury watch shop in piccadilly have been sentenced at blackfriars crown court .
sentencing the four , judge sally cahill said : `` in my view this was a professionally planned commercial robbery . ''
four officers were injured after the met 's flying squad had a tip-off about the robbery and police intercepted the men 11.25 on 3 august .
the gang caused more than £ 100,000 worth of damage .
on the way to the foiled robbery , the court heard how the men drove stolen mopeds dangerously , mounting pavements and going up one way streets .
`` terrified '' members of the public saw visible weapons sticking out from their clothing and called the police .
all four men were wearing balaclavas and full faced motorbike helmets .

documents.title: afternoon weather : dry , cold and windy
text: the afternoon will stay dry , cold and rather cloudy .
it will be breezy , especially over higher ground such as the north downs .
maximum temperature : 11c ( 52f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: tube strike on piccadilly and hammersmith & city lines
text: hundreds of london underground drivers are to stage a 24-hour strike next month in two separate disputes , coinciding with another walkout by guards on southern rail .

members of the rail , maritime and transport ( rmt ) union on the piccadilly and hammersmith & city lines will walk out from 21:30 on tuesday 6 december over claims of a breakdown in industrial relations , breaches of procedures and bullying and harassment of staff .
the piccadilly line is one of the busiest on the london underground network and serves heathrow airport .
the stoppage will coincide with a two-day strike on 6 and 7 december .
by rmt members on southern railway in the long-running row over changes to the role of conductors .

documents.title: tube strike announced for december
text: hundreds of london underground drivers are to stage a 24-hour strike over 6 and 7 december in two separate disputes , coinciding with another walkout by guards on southern rail , the rmt union announced .

ambassador to the united kingdom , matthew barzun , spoke at the service .

i think it 's safe to say a lot has happened since i last stood up here 12 months ago '

documents.title: woman , 87 , 'critical ' after robbery near camden home
text: an 87-year-old woman is in a critical condition in hospital after a robbery near her camden home .
she was returning from grocery shopping when she was followed into the communal lobby of her block of flats in albert street by an unknown man .
he snatched her bag and made off and the victim , a former art teacher , entered her flat and told a relative she lives with what happened .
the relative left the room to call the police and when she returned found the victim collapsed .
detective inspector adam ghaboos , from camden cid said : `` this was a nasty robbery which has left an elderly lady fighting for her life .
our thoughts are with the victim and her family and friends during this difficult time .
`` we are determined to find the person responsible and we would urge any witnesses or anyone with information to contact the police or crimestoppers as soon as possible . ''

documents.title: teen dies after stabbing outside harrow kebab shop
text: a teenager has died after being stabbed outside a kebab shop in north west london .
hussein ahmed , from edgware , was knifed outside the kebabish takeaway on northolt road , harrow , at 17:10 last friday .
the 19-year-old was pronounced dead yesterday after his life-support was withdrawn .
a post-mortem examination will take place later .
police believe mr ahmed was attacked by a group of black males aged in their teens or 20s and are appealing for witnesses to help in what they are now treating as a murder investigation .
four people were arrested on monday on sus of attempted murder and have been released on bail , the metropolitan police said .
a 17-year-old man was also injured in the attack .
he sustained a `` minor laceration '' to his abdomen but was later discharged from hospital .

documents.title: robinson named charlton athletic boss
text: robinson named charlton athletic boss

documents.title: autumn statement analysis : what did london gain ?
text: the mayor of london might not have got everything he wanted from this autumn statement - but more than £ 3bn for affordable housing and control over the adult education budget is a pretty good get for a new labour mayor working under a tory government .
the housing cash comes with a catch though .
he has to use it to build 90,000 new homes - and this is a london mayor who had so far shied away from pinning down how many homes he 'd actually aim to build .
now the government has set that target for him .
if he does n't meet the challenge , no doubt they will ask 'why not ?
we gave you the cash ' .
sadiq khan has admitted to bbc radio london that building 90,000 homes `` will be a slog '' - although he said it was `` achievable '' .
the autumn statement also saw some movement for london on skills - with city hall taking control of adult education and back to work programmes , alongside local councils .
but london did n't get control over skills for 16-18 year-olds , which is a power the mayor really wants .
there was also no word on social care funding which london councils had called for .
the absence of any mention of rail devolution for london was a disappointment to sadiq khan - who has beenpushing to take suburban rail services off southern .
read my colleague tom edwards ' blog on this .
philip hammond 's first and last autumn statement may well have been focused on infrastructure - but very little of that focus will help london - because he thinks the capital is productive enough .
the chancellor said no other country had such a huge economic gap as the uk has between its capital city and its other big cities .
so areas outside london were the ones that needed investment to help to `` drive up productivity '' .
but london 's mayor told bbc radio london that this `` is n't a zero sum game '' , that just because london 's doing well , it did n't mean that the rest of the country could n't do well too .
he warned the government to be careful that it does n't `` destroy the jobs , growth and prosperity we have in london particularly post-brexit '' .
author: Susana Mendonca
BBC Radio London Political Reporter

documents.title: club drug testing 'may be useful ' says police chief
text: one of the country 's leading police chiefs says recreational drug testing `` may well be very useful '' .
but commander simon bray , the national police chiefs ' council lead for drugs , says he ca n't yet fully endorse it `` on a national basis '' .
front of house testing was trialled at two festivals in the uk this summer - secret garden party , in cambridgeshire , and kendal calling in cumbria .
switzerland pioneered this more open approach first .
author: BBC Newsbeat

documents.title: cctv released after shop robbery in dagenham
text: police in east london want to identify three men in connection with a robbery in dagenham , east london .
it happened on sunday , 23 october just before 14:00 at a1 cash and carry on broad street .
a packet of cigarettes , a drink and a bag of sweets were taken during the robbery and when the shop keeper confronted the suspects he sustained a cut to his shin .
one of the men was believed to be carrying a gun .

documents.title: child sex abuse : inquiries into claims of police failings
text: the independent police complaints commission says it is handling 187 investigations into potential police failures in dealing with past child sex abuse cases in england and wales .
a bbc freedom of information request revealed 27 completed inquiries have resulted in potential disciplinary action against up to 15 officers .
eighteen forces are the subject of complaints about the handling of abuse .
these include what the ipcc has called potential `` high-level corruption '' .
author: Tom Symonds
Home Affairs Correspondent

documents.title: dating apps must protect users better , says npcc
text: dating apps `` must take more responsibility '' for protecting their users ' safety on dates , the national police chiefs ' council ( npcc ) has said .
it comes after stephen port was found guilty of murdering four men he had met through such apps and websites .
chief constable jane sawyers , police lead for lgbt issues , said apps should provide safety messages .
one app , grindr , did not reply to a request for comment .
tinder said it took users ' safety `` very seriously '' .

documents.title: police officer hurt after fall into basement during child welfare investigation
text: a police officer has been hurt after falling into a basement area while attending an incident involving the welfare of a child last night .
police in lambeth were called to harleyford road in se11 at 23:30 following child welfare concerns .
a woman was found on scaffolding outside her window and she then made her way onto the roof .
a police negotiator is still at the scene .
the injured police officer was hurt last night after falling from the ground floor into the basement area of the property .
the london air ambulance .
took him to hospital and he remains in a. serious but stable condition .

luckily for arsenal he has been hit and miss tonight ,

and that chance comes tonight as he starts against paris st. germain in the champions league , with theo walcott dropping down to the bench .

documents.title: killer guilty of murdering four men
text: killer guilty of murdering four men

documents.title: port used blonde wig to lure victims
text: port used blonde wig to lure victims

documents.title: deaths 'should have triggered alarm bells '
text: human rights advocate peter tatchell monitored the police handling of the serial killings of young gay men in east london from october 2014 .
`` the police appeal for public information came in october 2015 - a year too late .
four young men were already dead .
this appeal should have been made in august 2014 after the first two killings .
if the police had done this , further deaths may have been prevented .
two of these men might still be alive , '' said mr tatchell .
the police let stephen port slip though their fingers .
he was arrested after the body of anthony walgate was found in june 2014 and was later jailed for perverting the course of justice in relation to his death .
`` astonishingly , officers accepted at face value port 's explanations concerning the death of walgate . ''
he said police failed to adequately check the hand-writing on the fake daniel whitworth suicide note , which had been penned by port to cover up the murder .

`` as far as we know , there was no thorough finger-print and dna testing of the note , which may have led direct to port , given that he had been previously arrested and imprisoned for untruths about his links with walgate .
concerns were raised with the police at the time three by friends of two of the victims , gabriel kovari and anthony walgate , but were ignored .
the men 's friends say they felt fobbed off by the police .

`` to have three young men found dead in public places in mysterious , unexplained circumstances - all within a few hundred yards of each other and within the space of three months - should have triggered alarm bells .
`` from the outset , the police investigation fell far short of thorough and robust . ''

documents.title: port not guilty of three charges of rape
text: port was found not guilty of raping one man on two separate occasions in october last year and then in january this year .
the jury found him not guilty of raping another man on new year 's eve in 2014 .
he was found guilty of all the other charges against 10 men .

documents.title: 'highly devious , manipulative and self-obsessed individual '
text: det ch insp tim duffield , who led the successful port homicide investigation and has been a police officer for 28 years , said : `` stephen port is probably one of the most dangerous individuals i 've encountered .
`` he 's a voracious sexual predator who appears to have been fixated , nay obsessed , with surreptitiously drugging young , often vulnerable men for the exclusive purpose of rape .
`` from what we 've seen as an investigation team , this is a highly devious , manipulative and self-obsessed individual .

`` throughout both the criminal investigation , many days of police interviews and during the course of a long trial , he has never once shown a shred of remorse for his victims or indeed their families . ''

documents.title: watch : from serial rapist to serial killer
text: the bbc 's daniel sandford reports on the crimes of serial killer stephen port , who has been found guilty of murdering four young men .

documents.title: 'specialist homicide investigators ' missed sus activity
text: some of the victims ' loved ones , members of the met 's lesbian , gay , bisexual and transgender ( lgbt ) independent advisory group and journalists from website pink news all raised concerns that a serial killer was at large , and were all told that there was no link between the deaths .
the original investigations into how the four men died were dealt with by officers based in barking and dagenham but they failed to spot that there had been foul play .

in the cases of the first victim , anthony walgate , and the third , daniel whitworth , local officers called out specialist homicide investigators for advice , who also missed signs that something sus had happened .

documents.title: 'potential opportunities missed ' to stop port
text: commander stuart cundy , who leads the met 's specialist crime and operations command , said : `` i ca n't sit here and say categorically that lives could have been saved or other victims protected .
`` all i can say is from the evidence we 've heard at trial there were potential opportunities that were missed .
the ipcc investigation will carefully consider those . ''

documents.title: ipcc has 'reached out to lgbt community '
text: ipcc commissioner cindy butts said : our thoughts are with everybody affected by the tragic deaths of anthony , gabriel , daniel and jack at the hands of stephen port .

it is important we establish whether the police response to the deaths of all four men was thorough and appropriate in the circumstances , including whether discrimination played any part in actions and decisions .
`` as his trial established , port was known to the police in connection to the death mr walgate .
we now know that tragically , three more young men went on to lose their lives .

i have met with lgbt community members in barking and dagenham to explain the ipcc 's role , and would like to provide the assurance that our investigators are continuing to work hard to scrutinise the police response to the tragic deaths of these four young men .
we would like to hear from anybody who provided information to the police about port , or any of his victims , between 19 june 2014 and 15 october 2015 . ''

documents.title: seven officers being investigated for gross misconduct
text: the ipcc is investigating the metropolitan police service 's ( mps ) response following the deaths of anthony walgate , 23 , gabriel kovari , 22 , daniel whitworth , 21 , and jack taylor , 25 .
the bodies of all four men were found in the barking area on separate dates between june 2014 and september 2015 .
the mps made a voluntary referral to the ipcc in october last year after it identified concerns regarding the initial investigations into the men 's deaths .
seven mps officers have been served with gross misconduct notices advising them their conduct is under investigation .
a further 10 officers have been served with misconduct notices .
the officers range in rank from constable to inspector .

documents.title: met voluntarily referred case to ipcc
text: met commander stuart cundy said from the evidence heard at the trial there were potentially missed opportunities in the original investigations for the met to look at .

because of this , he said the met had voluntarily referred the case to the independent police complaints commission ( ipcc ) to independent assess what actions were or were not taken in those investigations .

documents.title: victim 's family going to sue police force
text: the family of stephen port 's last murder victim said they are `` definitely '' planning to sue after officers at first dismissed his death as `` just another '' drug overdose .
they say jack taylor would be alive today if police had `` done their job '' and investigated the series of `` unexplained '' deaths in the area around port 's flat .
mr taylor , 25 , was found dead near barking abbey graveyard on september 14 2015 , in almost identical circumstances to port 's other victims .

documents.title: police reviewing 58 deaths in london involving ghb
text: police reviewing 58 deaths in london spanning 4 years in which ghb was involved to see if any are sus # port
noncrimes per year useful too : not in crime stats .
time for change

documents.title: port : police urge victims to come forward
text: the met police believe there are more victims of stephen port and urge them to come forward .

documents.title: police watchdog investigating met 's handling of murders
text: the police watchdog - the independent police complaints commission ( ipcc ) - is investigating the force 's initial response to the murders .
seventeen officers are under formal investigation .

documents.title: judge considering a 'whole life ' tariff for port
text: judge warns stephen # port that he 's considering imposing a `` whole life '' tariff when he sentences on friday .

documents.title: port also guilty of four rapes and assault
text: stephen port has also been found guilty of four rapes , four counts of assault by penetration , and six counts of administering a substance with intent .
these counts relate to seven living complainants .
he was found not guilty of three rapes relating to two living complainants .
the serial killer will be sentenced on friday .

documents.title: port guilty of murders and drugging men with intent
text: stephen port has been found guilty of the murder of anthony walgate , gabriel kovari , daniel whitworth and jack taylor .
he also been found guilty of administering a substance with intent in relation to the four men .

documents.title: london business school building opened by former mba student after £ 25m donation
text: the founder of chemicals giant ineos has formally opened a building named after him at the london business school after he donated £ 25 million to help it remain one of the best in the world .
jim ratcliffe obtained an mba from the school in 1980 while working for exxon chemicals as a chemical engineer and said he has fond memories of his studies .
he said : `` i owe a lot to london business school and i have fond memories of studying here .
it is a magnificent building and i am delighted to help the school secure its long term future . ''
he said the donation will secure london business school 's home at regent 's place , regent 's park , london , for the next 125 years .

documents.title: 1,661 died on 19 july 'due to heatwave '
text: a blistering heatwave this summer led to a spike in deaths , new figures suggest .
the elderly , infants and people who suffer from a number of pre-existing health conditions are at particular risk during a heatwave .
new provisional figures from the office for national statistics ( ons ) show that the soaring temperatures in summer 2016 led to an `` unusual peak in mortality '' on 19 july .
on this day , when temperatures peaked at 33.5c ( 92.3f ) , there were 1,661 deaths recorded in england and wales .
this compared with a five-year average of 1,267 , the ons said .

text: your round-up of the latest headlines for london courtesy of alex bushill .

documents.title: thameslink slammed for football fans ' 'journey from hell '
text: a group of soccer fans endured a `` rail journey from hell '' after it took them more than five and a half hours to get home from a game .
the sutton united supporters were hit by a spate of cancellations on thameslink , the operator owned by the same franchise which runs southern railway .
the vanarama league game at boreham wood finished at 21:00 last night with the group of around 50 sutton fans expecting a 90-minute journey home - bad enough after seeing their team lose 1-0 .
the supporters said they were first hit with a spate of cancellations at borehamwood which delayed them for nearly an hour .
eventually they got a train to london blackfriars , where the sutton connecting service was cancelled .
after another delay , they got on the last sutton service , which got stuck behind a broken train at herne hill and also hit southern services .

the fans said they were `` dumped '' at loughborough junction , which was closed and locked up , before a train took them back to blackfriars , where they waited nearly two hours for taxis home , eventually arriving back in sutton at 03:15 .

documents.title: police officer stabbed in bow pub attack
text: a police officer has been stabbed in an attack near a pub while on duty in east london last night .
the plain clothes officer was attacked near the bows bell pub on bow road , bow , at 21:22 .
he has been taken to hospital in a non-life threatening condition .
a man has been arrested on sus of attempted murder .
a knife has been recovered , the met police said .
scotland yard said the stabbing was not being treated as terrorist-related .

documents.title: what is the autumn statement ?
text: the autumn statement is the second of the two big economic statements made by the government every year - the first being the budget which happens in the spring .
this year 's autumn statement takes place today at about 12:30 ( after prime minister 's questions ) .
but what is the point of it ?
bbc business have the answers .

documents.title: lettings agent fees will be banned
text: good news for londoners look to rent new rooms and flats - lettings agents will be banned from charging fees to tenants under plans to be announced by the chancellor in his autumn statement .
tenants can be charged fees for a range of administration , including reference , credit and immigration checks .
philip hammond will say that shifting the cost to landlords will save 4.3 million households hundreds of pounds .
the move could spur competition as landlords , unlike tenants , can shop around for the cheapest agent .

overall , along with rent in advance and a deposit , the average upfront costs faced by renters using a letting agency are more than £ 1,000 nationally and over £ 2,000 in london , according to shelter .
author: Kevin Peachey
Personal finance reporter

documents.title: hit-and-runs on the increase
text: statistics obtained by the green party in london show the number of hit-and-run casualties in the capital rose for the seventh year in a row .
the total hit-and-run incidents have increased 60 % since 2009 , while the number of fatalities increased for the first time in three years .
hit-and-runs have increased both in number terms and as a percentage of total collisions with drivers now failing to stop after one in five crashes .
the data was obtained by sian berry , who represents the green party in the london assembly , and her predecessor jenny jones through questions to the mayor of london and fois .

BBC London

documents.title: hundreds turn out to say goodbye to 'hugely popular ' ricky hayden
text: the 300-strong procession led by a horse drawn carriage has left ricky hayden 's home in chadwell heath and is heading towards the local chicken shop where .
ricky 's dad paul will buy his son his `` last meal . ''
mr hayden said : `` ricky loved his chicken . ''
flowers mounted on top of the coffin read `` son '' `` uncle '' `` grandson '' and `` nephew '' .
all the flowers are orange - ricky 's favourite colour and his nickname was `` ginge '' .
people here are also holding orange balloons with hand-written messages .
they will release 100 balloons in memory of ricky shortly .
ricky 's mother suzanne , sister april , brother perry and father paul embraced as the carriage pulled away .
friends , family and neighbours have come to lay flowers and pay their respects today .
ricky was a hugely popular figure here and was known to many through his work in nightclub security and with havering council .
the local community has raised a lot of money for the funeral costs .
police have also placed cones along rose lane and closed the road to traffic .
officers will line both sides of the main road as the procession makes it way along .
police will follow the procession on bikes too .
author: Emilia Papadopoulos
BBC London

documents.title: ricky hayden : funeral procession about to start in chadwell heath
text: the procession about to start ; six cars and a horse drawn carriage carrying ricky 's coffin .
author: Emilia Papadopoulos
BBC London

documents.title: mourners gather in orange to say farewell to ricky hayden
text: hundreds of people have started gathering outside the home where ricky hayden was killed in east london .
his favourite colour was orange and all the men here are wearing orange ties and ladies orange scarves .
there are orange flowers and balloons .
author: Emilia Papadopoulos
BBC London

documents.title: hit-and-run 'every two hours ' in london
text: there was a hit-and-run every two hours on london 's roads last year , according to new data .
nearly 5,000 londoners were the victims of hit-and-runs last year according to statistics obtained by london assembly member , sian berry .
of those collisions 11 people died , 287 had serious injuries and 4,647 were left with slight injuries .

documents.title: man sought after 'terrifying sex attacks '
text: detectives are hunting a suspected sex attacker who subjected two women to `` terrifying ordeals '' .
cctv footage has been released of an asian man , aged between 25 and 35 , thought to have targeted the victims in clapham , south london .
in the first attack , at about 02:00 on 22 may , he followed a woman into the communal hallway of flats in clapham common south side and sexually assaulted her .
she managed to fight him off and he ran away .

about a month later , on 26 june , again at about 02:00 , he sexually assaulted a 27-year-old woman in klea avenue , after sneaking up behind her and pushing her into the communal area of some flats .
she managed to scratch him in the face with her key , close to his left eye , and he ran off .
det insp andrew wadey said : `` these incidents were terrifying ordeals for both victims . ''

documents.title: flowers and tributes ahead of ricky hayden 's funeral in east london
text: the funeral of celebrity bodyguard ricky hayden is taking place in east london today .
mr hayden , 27 , was fatally stabbed in the thigh outside his chadwell heath home on 13 september .
his father , paul , 46 , was also stabbed in the attack .
family , friends and neighbours will begin to gather near his home ahead of a large procession through the neighbourhood towards the crematorium .
london 's emilia papadopoulos has been invited by mr hayden 's family to report on the event .

documents.title: couple jailed for funding is nephew
text: couple jailed for funding is nephew

documents.title: your views : should london have more autonomy ?
text: you 've been posting on our facebook page your views on whether sadiq khan is right to be pushing for london to have more power over issues like taxation as in hamburg :
adam barnes : `` mayor khan needs to sort out the problems with tube strikes before takes on extra responsibilities .
not shown he can cope with what he already has ! ``

john paul : `` ( greater ) london 's population ( 8.67 million ) is roughly equivalent to the world 's 97th largest country ( israel/ 8.61 million ) and it homes nearly 1/8th of the uks total population ( 65.11 million ) , which is over 13 % , so perhaps there is a strong case for more autonomy , in light of what 's happening more broadly at the moment ( brexit , potus , forthcoming european elections etc . )
but with power comes responsibility and accountability . ''
author: BBC London Facebook

documents.title: a stoke newington school for the poor is converted to a haven for the funds of the cash-rich
text: this handsome late-georgian stoke newington school was built in 1837 for the poor .
almost two centuries on , it has been converted to homes for the rich .
author: Loving Dalston
Community news website

documents.title: schoolchildren launch `` vicious attack '' on two met officers after knife search
text: a group of up to 30 schoolchildren attacked two uniformed met officers in south-east london during a knife search .
scotland yard is now appealing for anyone who took mobile phone footage to come forward .

the incident happened at about 16:00 on 9 november in goodwood road , lewisham , when the officers approached the group during a routine patrol and a large knife was spotted being concealed by a young male .
after trying to search the suspect , the met says one officer was violently punched in the face several times by other youths .
the second officer stepped in to help her colleague and she was punched in the jaw .
the male officer was then repeatedly kicked in the head while down leaving him with serious bruising , say police .
a 15-year-old male was arrested on sus of actual bodily harm .
he has been bailed .

detective sergeant jenny white , of lewisham police , said : `` i 'm appealing to anyone who witnessed this shocking attack on two officers to come forward and speak with us , particularly anyone with mobile phone footage of the incident .
`` it happened at a very busy time of the day and there would 've been a large number of people in the area .
`` these officers go to work every day to keep the public safe and this demonstrates the dangers the police can face while carrying out these duties . ''

documents.title: who will be london 's next top police officer ?
text: it hardly needed an advertisement did it ?

the job of metropolitan police commissioner is the most influential , high-profile and challenging role in policing in the uk - and , arguably , the most prestigious law enforcement post in the world .
but the recruitment process , albeit only a few days old , has already been marked by the refusal of several possible contenders to put themselves forward .
author: Danny Shaw
BBC Home Affairs Correspondent

documents.title: travel update : signal failure hits east croydon and london overground services
text: there are delays on all trains through east croydon because of a signal failure in the norwood junction area .
it 's also causing problems for london overground which has minor delays between highbury & islington and crystal palace / west croydon .
the heathrow express and heathrow connect are not calling at terminal 4 because of technical problems .
and on the tube there are minor delays for the waterloo & city and piccadilly lines because of faulty trains .
for the latest information go to our travel page or follow us on twitter @ twitterid
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: david hockney to design queen 's westminster abbey window
text: artist david hockney is to design a stained glass window in westminster abbey to celebrate the queen 's reign .
the artist , who once turned down the chance to paint the monarch because he was too busy , said he has `` planned a landscape full of blossom that 's a celebration every year . ''
the 20ft ( 6.1m ) x 6ft ( 1.8m ) window in the abbey 's north transept will be known as the queen 's window .
the cost is being covered by two anonymous benefactors .

documents.title: southern 'providing more trains ' for latest rmt strike
text: southern rail passengers facing disruption from the latest rmt strike have been told 62 % of the normal timetable will be operating .
union members walked out for 48 hours at midnight in the long-running dispute over the role of conductors on trains .
southern said it was doing `` everything it could to provide as many services for passengers as possible '' .
the rmt said the number of services southern hoped to run was `` perhaps a bit ambitious '' .

documents.title: fabric agrees to strict new licensing rules
text: following the news that fabric nightclub has agreed a licensing deal to reopen its doors , islington council and the nightclub have issued this joint statement :

`` fabric has offered many new additional conditions to be added to its licence , all of which are designed to ensure a zero tolerance approach to drug possession , consumption and sale within the club .
it has also developed a new and detailed iso accredited operations manual setting out how compliance with these conditions is to be achieved , from the top to the bottom of its operation .
`` fabric accepts that its procedures in relation to searching were insufficient , as were its procedures to prevent the consumption and dealing of drugs within the club itself .
fabric accepts that the police acted reasonably in making the application for a review and that the authority 's sub-committee was fully entitled to revoke its licence .
fabric repudiates the online abuse aimed at committee members and council staff and will permanently exclude anyone who has been found to be involved . ''
the measures to be introduced include :

documents.title: tfl could lose funding if garden bridge is n't built , says minister
text: the government has announced that transport for london ( tfl ) may lose central funding if the garden bridge project was to fall through .
nearly £ 60m of government funds have been contributed to the bridge , including £ 30m from transport for london - £ 20m of which has been pledged as a loan to be repaid in full .

in an answer to a written question transport minister andrew jones announced that if the the garden bridge ends up not being built the government would be `` likely to claw back the unspent part of its original £ 30m contribution from transport for london by reducing a future [ greater london authority ] transport grant payment '' .
the transport grant is paid by the department for transport to the gla , which in turn pays the grant to tfl .
this year £ 436m was paid to tfl through the grant .
london mayor sadiq khan has asked for a review of the garden bridge to examine whether the project was achieved value for money .

documents.title: sisters uncut : domestic violence protest blocks waterloo bridge
text: a central london river crossing was shut down by activists protesting against cuts to domestic violence services .
sisters uncut staged a sit-in on the centre of waterloo bridge yesterday meaning traffic was backed up on both sides .
the group said two out of three women are turned away from refuge shelters in london and that black , disabled and migrant women are adversely affected .
bristol , newcastle , glasgow and brighton also saw similar protests .

documents.title: southern railway conductors ' strike ad campaign 'a mistake '
text: a rail executive has admitted .
an `` absolutely shocking '' advertising campaign urging passengers to contact the union at the centre of a bitter dispute over changes to the role of conductors was a mistake .

the move by southern railway led to a flurry of complaints by its passengers against the company rather than the rail , maritime and transport union ( rmt ) , which has been taking industrial action for months in protest at the controversial changes .

alex foulds , deputy chief operating officer of govia thameslink railway , which owns southern , faced criticism over the adverts when he was questioned by councillors in the london borough of lambeth .
mr foulds said the adverts were a `` mistake '' , adding that the rmt had also made mistakes , describing the current climate as `` very tense '' .

he apologised for the level of service being provided by southern , whose services have been delayed , disrupted or cancelled for months because of the industrial action , staff shortages and other problems .
he conceded that southern was the worst-performing train operator in the country `` by some distance '' .

documents.title: large fire breaks out near heathrow airport
text: a large fire engulfed a garden centre near heathrow airport , sending plumes of smoke across west london .
up to 100 firefighters tackled the blaze at ansell garden centre on holloway lane , sipson , which broke out just after 16:30 gmt .
a 300m ( 1,000ft ) cordon was put in place to prevent an explosion after crews discovered cylinders and fireworks , london fire brigade said .
heathrow flights were not affected and no-one was injured .
